title: Which battle in World War 1 had the most countries involved? - Quora

response.answer_text: So I miss read the question and thought World War 2. Sorry about the Bad Answer. This one is good for World War 2. The Battle of Cassino had troops from up to 13 countries or Nationalities. Some of the Nationalities involved Britain United States Poland New Zealand Canada German Italian Jewish troops from Palestine (transportation) South African Indian Free French (and her colonies, Morocco, etc) and more that I can’t remember

The 100day campaign. Not really a battle but a series of interconnected battles on the Western Front, which involved the armies of the following countries: Germay Austria Australia Belgium Canada France India Italy New Zealand South Africa UK (England, Scotland, Ireland and Wales) USA
